author: anon.
statepreservation: -single papyrus fragment (18 x 15 cm) with the remains of 12 lines of writing on the recto and of 15 lines of writing on the verso side-wide margins of ca. 5 cm (bottom margin has been preserved)-codex originally measured 18 x 30 cm
lectionalsigns: -cancellation and correction (second hand)-three point diacritic mark on ? and ? (added by second hand)-abbreviation for ending ? as a horizontal-each new entry starts on a new line; second and any further lines of an entry are distinguished from the first line by eisthesis; blank spaces separate lemmata from explanation
hand: -second hand (different type of ink) is responsible for corrections and additions
